title: Learning Temporal 3D Semantic Scene Completion via Optical Flow Guidance
author: Meng Wang (Hunan University), Fan Wu (Hunan University), Ruihui Li (Hunan University), Yunchuan Qin (Hunan University), Zhuo Tang (Hunan University), Kenli Li (Hunan University)
relevance_why: The framework proposed could potentially enhance audio-visual modeling by leveraging motion analysis and temporal features, which are relevant in audio scene understanding.
background: The task involves accurately predicting the geometry and semantics of a 3D scene using multiple RGB images over time, which is critical for autonomous driving applications.
contribution: This paper introduces FlowScene to solve the challenge of temporal scene completion using optical flow guidance, achieving state-of-the-art performance on benchmark datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with temporal consistency and effectively capturing scene dynamics from sparse information.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by incorporating optical flow for feature alignment and aggregation, enabling a more comprehensive understanding of dynamic scenes.

key_innovation: Utilizes optical flow to enhance temporal feature aggregation and resolves occlusion issues in 3D modeling, leading to more precise scene completions.
real_world_impact: Enhancing scene understanding can significantly improve decision-making processes in autonomous vehicles, leading to safer navigation in complex environments.
limitations: No specific limitations have been mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.3D Semantic Scene Completion: **3D Semantic Scene Completion** refers to the task of predicting dense representations of 3D environments along with their semantic classifications based on incomplete observations.
new_terms.Optical Flow: **Optical Flow** is the pattern of apparent motion of objects in a visual scene based on the movement between two successive frames.
